oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Approximate transcription of Claude Bailey's inscription in Pilgrim Feet. by author Margaret Sherwood describing her life. Inscription written in February 1959.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Transcript of inscription written by Lieutenant Commander Claude Bailey in 1959 describing Margaret Sherwood, who was born and spent her childhood in Ballston, NY. Margaret Sherwood was the author of over 17 books, at least one of which takes place in Ballston. She is buried in Briggs Cemetery west of Ballston Spa, NY. Original inscription is in Pilgrim Feet, a mostly autobiographical book located in the Town of Ballston Community Library Historical Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bailey, Claude
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Authors; Letters; Biography;
Inscriptions
Daily Life; Community & Events; People;
Ballston - Saratoga County - New York
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: transcript; 8.5 x 11 in. (21.5 x 28 cm.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights:

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Underground Tunnel in the basement of the Buell Mansion Ballston Lake
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This is the entrance to the underground tunnel in the basement of the Buell Mansion on Midline Road in Ballston Lake, New York. This originally led to a tunnel which went southwest to the barn. It may have been used as part of the Underground Railroad prior to and during the Civil War.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Richard Reynolds
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Underground Railroad; Civil war; antislavery movements; Fugitive slaves;
